text: Emanuel Scherer (1901–1977) was a Polish-Jewish politician. ==Life== Emanuel Scherer graduated from the Jagiellonian University in Kraków, and became active in the Bund youth movement there. Later he moved to Warsaw, where he continued to be an active politician in the Bund party, in 1935 joining its Central Committee. In 1938 he was elected to the Warsaw City Council. During World War II Scherer was able to escape to the West, where he took part in the work of the Polish government in exile. He was a member of the National Council of Poland and acted as the Bund's representative following Szmul Zygielbojm's death. After the war he emigrated to the United States, where he was a secretary in the International Jewish Labor Bund. Scherer died in 1977. ==References== ==External links== *Emanuel Scherer papers, USHMM Category:1901 births Category:1977 deaths Category:Bundists Category:Polish Jews Category:Polish politicians Category:Polish emigrants to the United States Category:General Jewish Labour Bund in Poland politicians
